trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight application.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight application.

trans-unit.source: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight), then refer to the [Windows Universal](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md) version.
trans-unit.target: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight), then refer to the [Windows Universal](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md) version.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you create a blank Windows Phone 8 app that receives push notifications by using the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you create a blank Windows Phone 8 app that receives push notifications by using the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Notification Hubs Windows Phone SDK does not support using the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS) with Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Notification Hubs Windows Phone SDK does not support using the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS) with Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.

trans-unit.source: To use WNS (instead of MPNS) with Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps, follow the [Notification Hubs - Windows Phone Silverlight tutorial], which uses REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: To use WNS (instead of MPNS) with Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps, follow the [Notification Hubs - Windows Phone Silverlight tutorial], which uses REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone], or a later version.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone], or a later version.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Windows Phone 8 apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Windows Phone 8 apps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fnotification-hubs-windows-phone-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fnotification-hubs-windows-phone-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: Create your notification hub
trans-unit.target: Create your notification hub

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services**, click **Service Bus**, click **Notification Hub**, and then click **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services**, click **Service Bus**, click **Notification Hub**, and then click **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a New Notification Hub**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a New Notification Hub**.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace that you just created (usually ***notification hub name*-ns**), and then click the **Configure** tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace that you just created (usually ***notification hub name*-ns**), and then click the **Configure** tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Notification Hubs** tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Notification Hubs** tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connection Information** at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connection Information** at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Configure** tab, and then click the **Enable unauthenticated push notifications** check box in the **Windows Phone notification settings** section.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Configure** tab, and then click the **Enable unauthenticated push notifications** check box in the **Windows Phone notification settings** section.

trans-unit.source: You now have the connection strings that are required to register your Windows Phone 8 app and send notifications.
trans-unit.target: You now have the connection strings that are required to register your Windows Phone 8 app and send notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.

trans-unit.source: MPNS unauthenticated mode comes with restrictions on notifications that you can send to each channel.
trans-unit.target: MPNS unauthenticated mode comes with restrictions on notifications that you can send to each channel.

trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs supports [MPNS authenticated mode](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsphone/develop/ff941099(v=vs.105).aspx).
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs supports [MPNS authenticated mode](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsphone/develop/ff941099(v=vs.105).aspx).

trans-unit.source: Connecting your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connecting your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, create a new Windows Phone 8 application.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, create a new Windows Phone 8 application.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2013 Update 2 or later, you instead create a Windows Phone Silverlight application.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2013 Update 2 or later, you instead create a Windows Phone Silverlight application.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, and then click **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, and then click **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Manage NuGet Packages** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Manage NuGet Packages** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Search for `WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed` and click **Install**, and then accept the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Search for `WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed` and click **Install**, and then accept the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the Azure Messaging library for Windows by using the WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the Azure Messaging library for Windows by using the WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statements:
trans-unit.target: Open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statements:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code at the top of **Application_Launching** method in App.xaml.cs:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code at the top of **Application_Launching** method in App.xaml.cs:

trans-unit.source: Make sure to insert the name of your hub and the connection string called **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to insert the name of your hub and the connection string called **DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app from MPNS, and then registers that channel URI with your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app from MPNS, and then registers that channel URI with your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: It also guarantees that the channel URI is registered in your notification hub each time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: It also guarantees that the channel URI is registered in your notification hub each time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial sends a toast notification to the device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial sends a toast notification to the device.

trans-unit.source: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the **BindToShellTile** method on the channel.
trans-unit.target: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the **BindToShellTile** method on the channel.

trans-unit.source: To support both toast and tile notifications, call both **BindToShellTile** and **BindToShellToast**.
trans-unit.target: To support both toast and tile notifications, call both **BindToShellTile** and **BindToShellToast**.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, expand **Properties**, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the **Capabilities** tab, and make sure that the **ID_CAP_PUSH_NOTIFICATION** capability is checked.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, expand **Properties**, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the **Capabilities** tab, and make sure that the **ID_CAP_PUSH_NOTIFICATION** capability is checked.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that your app can receive push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that your app can receive push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A registration message is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A registration message is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Send the notification from your backend
trans-unit.target: Send the notification from your backend

trans-unit.source: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the REST interface.
trans-unit.target: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the REST interface.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" ([.NET backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-phone-get-started-push.md) | [JavaScript backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-phone-get-started-push.md)).
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" ([.NET backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-phone-get-started-push.md) | [JavaScript backend](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-phone-get-started-push.md)).

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP" ([Java](notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md) | [PHP](notification-hubs-php-backend-how-to.md)).
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP" ([Java](notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md) | [PHP](notification-hubs-php-backend-how-to.md)).

trans-unit.source: Right-click the solution, select **Add** and **New Project...**, and then under **Visual C#**, click **Windows** and **Console Application**, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the solution, select **Add** and **New Project...**, and then under **Visual C#**, click **Windows** and **Console Application**, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: This adds a new Visual C# console application to the solution.
trans-unit.target: This adds a new Visual C# console application to the solution.

trans-unit.source: You can also do this in a separate solution.
trans-unit.target: You can also do this in a separate solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the , click **Tools**, click **Library Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the , click **Tools**, click **Library Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: In the console window, set **Default project** to your new console application project, and then in the console window, execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: In the console window, set **Default project** to your new console application project, and then in the console window, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK with the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK with the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Open the file Program.cs and add the following `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the file Program.cs and add the following `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: In the **Program** class, add the following method:
trans-unit.target: In the **Program** class, add the following method:

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the **Notification Hubs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the **Notification Hubs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."
trans-unit.target: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Make sure that you use the connection string with **Full** access, not **Listen** access.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Make sure that you use the connection string with **Full** access, not **Listen** access.

trans-unit.source: The listen-access string does not have permissions to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: The listen-access string does not have permissions to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Add the following line in your **Main** method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following line in your **Main** method:

trans-unit.source: With your Windows Phone emulator running and your app closed, set the console application project as the default startup project, and then press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: With your Windows Phone emulator running and your app closed, set the console application project as the default startup project, and then press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You will receive a toast notification.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a toast notification.

trans-unit.source: Tapping the toast banner loads the app.
trans-unit.target: Tapping the toast banner loads the app.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the possible payloads in the [toast catalog] and [tile catalog] topics on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: You can find all the possible payloads in the [toast catalog] and [tile catalog] topics on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your Windows Phone 8 devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your Windows Phone 8 devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
